result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald E Marin Rivera

records.addlTxt: Defendant Record Update
Matter set for a P/S on 11/11/2022 at 11:00 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

**CASH BOND AMENDED ON AUGUST 8, 2022**
5/13/2022 Bond is modified from $5,000 cash to $1,200 cash:
Conditions:
H.M. must go to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then file the forms with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  
(05-17-2022: CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: H.S.M. - wants contact)
If the victim consents in writing that she wants contact and that consent needs to be in the court file and the DA file, the court will allow contact between the defendant and H.M., A.M., B.M., E.M.  That contact is to be no violent or abusive contact or any type of threatening behavior.
Parties may now live together.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in the Portage County Pretrial Supervision Program and comply with all conditions of that program.

9:07 AM Defendant Donald E Marin Rivera in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Donald E Marin Rivera. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.

This is set for a Motion Hearing to Modify the Bond.
State will not oppose the modification of the bond.

Court questions if there is an agreement to the new bond.
ADA Cassidy states the bond agreement on the record.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim is present and makes a statement to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is modified with the updated conditions as stated on the record.
Pretrial Supervision Status Report dated 08-05-2022
Motion hearing on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 07/12/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Record Update

10:45 AM Defendant Donald E Marin Rivera in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Donald E Marin Rivera. 

ADA Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Case to be pretried today.

ADDRESS INFO for Donald E Marin Rivera
Current: 2020 East Ave, 54481, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 05-05-2022)
Prior: 1417 Fourth Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Arraignment on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Pretrial Supervision Status Report dated 05-19-2022
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: H.S.M.
Portage County Justice Point Referral to Pre-Trial Supervision

5/13/2022 Bond is modified from $5,000 cash to $1,200 cash:
Conditions:
H.M. must go to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then file the forms with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  
(05-17-2022: CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: H.S.M. - wants contact)
If the victim consents in writing that she wants contact and that consent needs to be in the court file and the DA file, the court will allow contact between the defendant and H.M., A.M., B.M., E.M.  That contact is to be no violent or abusive contact or any type of threatening behavior.
That does not mean they can live together.  Court will not allow that. 
Visits are to be outside the residence where H.S.M. is living with the children. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with all conditions of that program.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donald E Marin Rivera appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County jail.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Donald E Marin Rivera. 

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant approves appearing in court. 

Atty Bergner makes arguments in support of the motion to dismiss count 2. 
Court questions Atty Bergner. 
Atty Cassidy states she can clarify that question and responds. 
Record to reflect that there is a woman sitting behind Atty Cassidy that was shaking her head while Atty Cassidy was reading. 
Court questions the woman who is determined to be H.S.M. 
H.S.M. clarifies she does not think the defendant would kill her. 
Atty Cassidy makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 
Atty Bergner makes rebuttal arguments. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court denies the motion finding to the level of probable cause only and the court has given reasonable inferences from the four corners of the complaint, it does meet that standard. 

Atty Bergner makes arguments in support of the motion to modify the bond. 
Court questions Atty Bergner. 
Atty Cassidy makes bond arguments in opposition to the motion.  

H.S.M. is present and is now seated next to Atty Cassidy. 
Court questions H.S.M. 
Defendant asks to make a statements. 
Court informs the defendant to get approval from his attorney.
Atty Bergner questions the defendant what he would want to talk about. 
Defendant responds. 
Court questions H.S.M. further. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court modifies the bond.  

H.S.M. makes additional statements. 
Court stops her and informs her of her rights.


5/16/22 - Clerk corrected amended bond amount from $2,500 cash to $1,200 cash.
Motion hearing on May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:44 PM Defendant Donald E Marin Rivera appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Donald E Marin Rivera. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Preliminary hearing to be held within time limits.
Atty Bergner informs the Court that he had filed a Motion to Dismiss Count 2 earlier in the day.
Court informs Atty Bergner that this will need to be taken up with the Judge assigned.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Count 2 filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner (sent to Br 2 JA on 05/09/22 sp)
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond. Filed by Atty Bergner.

1:00 PM 
Defendant appears from Jail via zoom video. Atty Mutchler appears for the State. Atty Max Bergner appears in person on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Criminal Damage to Property, Threats to Injure, Felony Bail Jumping, Disorderly Conduct. 
Atty Bergner makes statements regarding the facts.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions Atty Mutchler.

Public defenders office will continue to represent the defendant.

State requests a $7500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner requests a signature bond with different conditions for reasons stated.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
